request.description: Deleting a comment.

Getting a list of comments to the topic with pagination (there are 15 comments per page by default). For CL and EL users, the "Employer_team"object and the "educator_team"object are returned respectively, containing the organization with the name, slug and logo. In the user object there is a "user_role_id" field by which you can understand whether the admin left this comment or not. To get a different number of comments (other than 15), you have to pass the "limit" parameter. It is possible to sort the list by any available field (topic_id, user_id, content, updated_at, created_at) through passing the sort parameter as sort = {field}, {asc || desc}

request.description:
# Getting a list of topics.
### By default, the list is sorted by date of the topic update in descending order.

To get a list for a specific company / college, you have to pass `scopes educator|{id}` for a college or `employer|{id}` for a company. To get the topics of all companies the `scopes=employer` has to be passed, for all colleges the `educator` has to be passed and for all the topics without a main organization "general" has to be passed.

For filtering by category, the "filters" parameter is used, for example, ```filters={"0": "category_id|in|1,13"}``` returns all the topics with categories 1 and 13,  ```filters={"0": "category_id|in|1"}``` returns topics only for the 1st category.


To sort by the number of comments, the "sort"parameter is passed, for example, "comments_count_descending" sorts by number of comments in descending order and "comments_count_ascending" sorts by number of comments in ascending order. To sort by a date of update, taking into account the date of the topic and comments update, the "updated_ascending" and "updated_descending" sortings are passed to sort by ascending order and descending order, respectively.
To load additional data, you can pass the "with" parameter, the available values are category, organizations.organization, organization.

request.description:
Getting statistics on the topic categories. In the response we get information about the category + number of topics in this category. Parameters:
* `scopes` - filters, available filters: * _employerStats | {{company_id}} _ - getting statistics only for those categories that contain topics related to this company, the number of topics also corresponds to this particular company, NOT to all the category topics. * _educatorStats | {{college_id}} _ - the analogue of the above parameter for Educator.
